00033 cVocabulary::cVocabulary( const cVocabulary& original ) 
00034 {
00035         m_size = original.m_size;
00036         m_buffer = new cVector3int[ m_size ];
00037         memcpy( m_buffer, original.m_buffer, sizeof(cVector3int)*m_size );
00038 
00039         m_clusters = original.m_clusters->createCopy();
00040         m_clusters->initialise( m_size, m_buffer );
00041 }

00056 void cVocabulary::clear()
00057 {
00058         if( NULL != m_buffer ) {
00059                 delete [] m_buffer;
00060                 m_buffer = NULL;
00061         }
00062 
00063         if( NULL != m_clusters ) {
00064                 delete m_clusters;
00065                 m_clusters = NULL;
00066         }
00067         m_size = 0;
00068 }

00074 bool cVocabulary::initialise( cClustering* ptClusterer,         
00075                                                           const unsigned int size,              
00076                                                           const cVector3int* buffer )   
00077 {
00078         // check input variables
00079         if( NULL == ptClusterer ||
00080                 0 == size ) {
00081                 return false; 
00082         }
00083 
00084 
00085         // create buffer
00086         if( NULL != m_buffer ) {
00087                 delete [] m_buffer ;
00088         }
00089         m_size = size;
00090         m_buffer = new cVector3int[ m_size ];
00091         if( NULL != buffer )
00092         {
00093                 memcpy( m_buffer, buffer, sizeof(cVector3int)*m_size );
00094         }
00095 
00096         m_clusters = ptClusterer->createCopy(); // a "new" allocation is done here
00097         m_clusters->initialise( m_size, m_buffer );
00098 
00099         return true;
00100 }

00105 bool cVocabulary::copy( const cVocabulary& original )   
00106 {
00107         // check that the original is ready
00108         if( original.isReady() == false ) {
00109                 return false; 
00110         }
00111 
00112         // create buffer
00113         if( NULL != m_buffer ) {
00114                 delete [] m_buffer ;
00115         }
00116         
00117         m_size = original.m_size;
00118         m_buffer = new cVector3int[ m_size ];
00119         memcpy( m_buffer, original.m_buffer, sizeof(cVector3int)*m_size );
00120 
00121         m_clusters = original.m_clusters->createCopy();
00122         m_clusters->initialise( m_size, m_buffer );
00123 
00124         return true;
00125 }

00131 bool cVocabulary::load( const char* fileName ) 
00132 {       
00133         if( !fileName ) {
00134                 return false;
00135         }
00136 
00137         std::ifstream file;
00138         file.open( fileName, std::ios::in | std::ios::binary );
00139         
00140         if( file.is_open() == false ) {
00141                 return false; 
00142         }
00143 
00144         // Check if binary with the header
00145         {       
00146                 char buffer[3];
00147 
00148                 std::streampos pos = file.tellg();
00149                 file.read( buffer, 3 );
00150                 if( 0 == memcmp( buffer, AGR_VOCABULARY_BIN_FILE_HEADER, 3 ) )
00151                 {
00152                         // binary
00153                         file.seekg( pos );
00154                         bool ret = loadBinary( file );
00155                         file.close();
00156                         return ret;                     
00157                 }
00158         }
00159 
00160         // The file is in ASCII format (or any other bad format)
00161         file.close();                   // close the file in binary format...
00162         file.open( fileName );  // ... to reopen it in ascii format
00163 
00164         bool ret = loadASCII( file );
00165         file.close();
00166         return ret;
00167 }

00173 bool cVocabulary::save( const char* fileName,   
00174                                                 const bool binary               
00175                                                  ) const
00176 {
00177         // Check input
00178         if( NULL == fileName ) {
00179                 return false;
00180         }
00181 
00182         // Only save ready vocabulary
00183         if( isReady() == false ) {
00184                 return false;
00185         }
00186 
00187         if( binary )
00188         {
00189                 std::ofstream file;
00190                 file.open( fileName, std::ios::out | std::ios::binary );
00191                 bool ret = saveBinary( file );
00192                 file.close();
00193                 return ret;
00194         }
00195         else 
00196         {
00197                 std::ofstream file;
00198                 file.open( fileName );
00199                 bool ret = saveASCII( file );
00200                 file.close();
00201                 return ret;
00202         }
00203 }

00211 bool cVocabulary::isReady() const
00212 {
00213         if( NULL == m_clusters          ||
00214                 NULL == m_buffer                )
00215         {
00216                 return false;
00217         }
00218 
00219         return true;
00220 }

00274 bool cVocabulary::loadASCII( std::ifstream& file )
00275 {
00276         if( file.is_open() == false ) {
00277                 return false;
00278         }
00279 
00280         // version checking
00281         unsigned int version;
00282         char str[100];
00283         file >> str >> str >> str >> str >> version;
00284         if( version != AGR_VOCABULARY_ASCII_FILE_VERSION )
00285         {
00286                 // TODO : backward compatibility
00287                 return false;
00288         }
00289         file.getline( str, 100, '\n' ); // EOL
00290 
00291         // clean vocabulary values
00292         clear();
00293 
00294         // Skip file info
00295         file.getline( str, 100, '\n' );
00296 
00297         // Buffer size
00298         file >> str >> m_size;
00299         m_buffer = new cVector3int [ m_size ];
00300         file.getline( str, 100, '\n' ); // EOL
00301 
00302         // Clustering technique
00303         file.getline( str, 100, '\n' ); // Only cKmeansClustering for the moment
00304         m_clusters = new cKmeansClustering;
00305         m_clusters->initialise( m_size, m_buffer );
00306 
00307         // Buffer
00308         file.getline( str, 100, '\n' ); // Empty line
00309         file.getline( str, 100, '\n' ); // Buffer info
00310         for( unsigned int i=0; i<m_size; i++ )
00311         {
00312                 file >> m_buffer[ i ].x >> m_buffer[ i ].y >> m_buffer[ i ].z ;
00313         }
00314         file.getline( str, 100, '\n' ); // Empty line
00315 
00316         return true;
00317 }

00324 bool cVocabulary::saveASCII( std::ofstream& file ) const
00325 {
00326         if( file.is_open() == false ) {
00327                 return false;
00328         }
00329 
00330         // File informations
00331         file << "ASCII Vocabulary File version " << AGR_VOCABULARY_ASCII_FILE_VERSION << std::endl;
00332         file << "Created with AGR v" << AGR_VERSION << "." << AGR_VERSION_MIN << std::endl;
00333         file << std::endl;
00334 
00335         // Buffer size
00336         file << "Size: " << m_size << std::endl;
00337 
00338         // Clustering type
00339         file << "Clustering type Id : cKmeansClustering" << std::endl; // For the moment, only cKmeansClustering
00340         file << std::endl;
00341 
00342         file << "Buffer :" << std::endl;
00343         for( unsigned int i=0; i<m_size; i++ )
00344         {
00345                 file << m_buffer[ i ].x << " " << m_buffer[ i ].y << " " << m_buffer[ i ].z << std::endl;
00346         }
00347 
00348         return true;
00349 }

00357 bool cVocabulary::loadBinary( std::ifstream& file )
00358 {
00359         if( file.is_open() == false ) {
00360                 return false;
00361         }
00362         
00363         {       // Binary header
00364                 char buffer[3];
00365                 if( !file.read( buffer, 3 ) ) {
00366                         return false;
00367                 }
00368 
00369                 // Check header
00370                 if( 0 != memcmp( buffer, AGR_VOCABULARY_BIN_FILE_HEADER, 3 ) ) {
00371                         return false;
00372                 }
00373         }
00374 
00375         {// Version
00376                 unsigned int version;
00377                 if( !file.read( (char*)(&version), sizeof(version) ) ) {
00378                         return false;
00379                 }
00380 
00381                 // Check header
00382                 if( version != AGR_VOCABULARY_BINARY_FILE_VERSION ) {
00383                         return false;
00384                 }
00385         }
00386         
00387         // Buffer size
00388         if( !file.read( (char*)(&m_size), sizeof(m_size) ) ) {
00389                 return false;
00390         }
00391         if( m_size == 0 ) {
00392                 return 0;
00393         }
00394         m_buffer = new cVector3int [ m_size ];
00395 
00396         // No clustering information : kmeans is expected
00397         m_clusters = new cKmeansClustering;
00398         m_clusters->initialise( m_size, m_buffer );
00399         
00400         // Buffer
00401         for( unsigned int i=0; i<m_size; i++ )
00402         {
00403                 if( !file.read( (char*)(&m_buffer[ i ].x), sizeof(int) ) ) {
00404                         return false;
00405                 }
00406                 if( !file.read( (char*)(&m_buffer[ i ].y), sizeof(int) ) ) {
00407                         return false;
00408                 }
00409                 if( !file.read( (char*)(&m_buffer[ i ].z), sizeof(int) ) ) {
00410                         return false;
00411                 }
00412         }
00413 
00414         return true;
00415 }

00423 bool cVocabulary::saveBinary( std::ofstream& file ) const
00424 {       
00425         if( file.is_open() == false ) {
00426                 return false;
00427         }
00428 
00429         // Binary header
00430         file.write( AGR_VOCABULARY_BIN_FILE_HEADER, 3 );
00431 
00432         // Version
00433         file.write( (char*)(&AGR_VOCABULARY_BINARY_FILE_VERSION), sizeof(unsigned int) );
00434         
00435         // Buffer size
00436         file.write( (char*)(&m_size), sizeof(m_size) );
00437 
00438         // No clustering information : kmeans is expected
00439         
00440         // Buffer
00441         for( unsigned int i=0; i<m_size; i++ )
00442         {
00443                 file.write( (char*)(&m_buffer[ i ].x), sizeof(int) );
00444                 file.write( (char*)(&m_buffer[ i ].y), sizeof(int) );
00445                 file.write( (char*)(&m_buffer[ i ].z), sizeof(int) );
00446         }
00447 
00448         return true;
00449 }
